p:
The experiments had a completely randomised design. All data were tested for normal distributions using the Kolmogorov–Smirnov test. An analysis of variance was conducted using Bartlett’s test. The significance of differences among the groups was determined with Duncan’s multiple range test at the significance level of p < 0.05. The analyses were performed using SAS software (SAS Institute Inc., Cary, NC, USA). In the experiment, the following general model was used:
(2)
Y i
= μ +
α i
+
δ
i j
where Y i is the observed dependent variable, μ is the overall mean, α i is the effect of dietary fat source and δ ij is the random error.
